question: Given below are four words out of which three are alike in a certain manner and one of them is different. select the different word.
solution: (c)Except Hypertension all three are deficiency diseases but hypertension is a high blood pressure. It is caused because of high eating of salt and not of fruits and vegetables and less exercise and being overweight.

question: In a certain code language, ‘FORENSIC’ is coded as ‘61218221419183’ and‘ DORM’ is coded as ‘4121813’. How will ‘CARAMEL’ be coded in that language?
solution:
(d)
Logic : vowels are coded as reverse alphabetical position and consonants are coded as per their alphabetical position CARAMEL is coded as 3 26 18 26 13 22 12.

question: The total of three numbers is 240. The second number is four times the first number. The third number is three times the first number. What will be the average of the three numbers?
solution:
(a)
Sum of three numbers is 240
So, average = 2403= 80

question: A cube is made by folding the given sheet. In the cube so formed, which of the following pairs of letters would be opposite to each other?
solution:
(a)
Opposite pair are : E and A, C and B, F and D
Option (a) is the correct answer.

question:
Read the given statements and conclusions carefully. Assuming that the information given in the statements is true, even if it appears to be at variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the given conclusions logically follows from the statements.
Statements:
Some bowls are cups.
All cups are glasses.
Some glasses are plates.
All plates are utensils.
Conclusions:
I. All bowls cannot be utensils.
II. All glasses cannot be utensils.
solution:
(d)

As there is no such indication which clearly says that All bowls cannot be utensils is false and same for second conclusion also. So, neither conclusion I and II is true.

question:

Swan : Cygnet
solution:
(c)
As young one of Swan is known as Cygnet in the same way Young one of Turkey is known as Poult.

solution: (c)

question:
Choose the alternative which is related to the third word in the same way as the second word is related to the first word.
Pauper : Rich :: Vengeful : ?
solution: (d)Opposite of ‘Pauper’ is ‘Rich’, Similarly Opposite of ‘Vengeful’ is ‘Remissive’.

question: In a certain code language, ‘YOU TOOK MY PLACE IN’ is written as ‘COU POON LC QVAKE IJ’. How will ‘COMPILE’ be written in that language?
solution:
(b)
Logic : coded as per corresponding position
C ↔ K, O ↔ O, M ↔ L, P ↔ Q, I ↔ I, L ↔ V, E ↔ E
So, COMPILE means KOLQIVE

r j u k t r j u k t r j u k t r j u k t r j u k t
jurtku is the correct answer.

question:

1. Recreation
2. Recede
3. Recorder
4. Recliner
5. Reconcile
6. Recognition
solution: (a)The correct dictionary order is: Recede → Recliner → Recognition → Reconcile → Recorder → Recreation.

DOWN, CRRU, BUMB, AXHI, ?

and I + 7 = P

question:
Select the correct combination of mathematical signs that can sequentially replace the * signs and balance the given equation.
14 * 7 * 39 * 133 * 19 * 130
solution:
(c)

14 × 7 + 39 - 133 ÷ 19 = 130
98 + 39 - 7 = 130
137 - 7 = 130 Hence Verified

Universe, Pluto, Solar system
solution:
(b)

17, 20, 80, 85, ?, 517
solution:
(d)
Logic : + 3, × 4, + 5, × 6 and so on…
Following the above logic 85 × 6 = 510

question: Ramesh is the father of Manideep. Ramesh has only two children. Manideep is the brother of Niharika. Niharika is the daughter of Kavita. Ananya is the granddaughter of Kavita. Sujit is the father of Ananya. How is Sujit related to Manideep?
solution:
(c)

Sujit is Mandeep’s sister's husband so he is brother-in-law of Manideep.

question:
How many triangles are there in the given figure?


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1667384423/word/media/image29.png
solution:
(c)

A triangle that is divided into two equal parts has 3 triangles inside it.
There are 4 such triangles so 3 × 4 = 12 triangles.

question: In which of the following years did Japan invade India resulting in the Battle of Imphal?
solution: (a) In 1944, Japan invaded India resulting in the Battle of Imphal in Manipur. Japanese armies attempted to destroy the allied forces at Imphal and invade India but were driven back into Burma with heavy losses.

question: Who among the following received the 'Global GoalKeeper’ Award in 2019?
solution: (b) Narendra Modi received the 'Global GoalKeeper’ Award in 2019 for the Swachh Bharat Abhiyan launched by the government on 2nd October 2014.

question: In 2020, who among the following became the most successful F1 driver with the most career wins, overtaking Michael Schumacher?
solution: (c) In 2020, Lewis Hamilton became the most successful F1 driver with the most career wins, overtaking Michael Schumacher. He is a British racing driver who made a record by winning the British Grand Prix eight times.

question: In 2020, which of the following tiger reserves won the ‘TX2 Award’ for its efforts to increase the tiger population?
solution: (b) In 2020, Pilibhit Tiger Reserve won the ‘TX2 Award’ for its efforts to increase the tiger population. It achieved this goal in just four years from 2014 when it had 25 tigers which went up to 65 in 2018. Pilibhit Tiger Reserve is in Uttar Pradesh.

question: Rajnikant Devidas Shroff was awarded the Padma Bhushan in the field of ______ in January 2021.
solution: (b) Rajnikant Devidas Shroff was awarded the Padma Bhushan in the field of trade and industry in January 2021. He was born in Kutch, Gujarat and the only industrialist to win the Padma Bhushan in 2021. He is also considered as India's ‘Crop Protection King’.

question: Which of the following statements is correct?
option_1: Magnetic flux is a vector quantity.
option_2: Two magnetic field lines may intersect.
option_3: The net magnetic flux through any closed surface is zero.
option_4: Earth's magnetic poles coincide with the geographic poles.
solution: (c) The net magnetic flux through any closed surface is zero. This is a correct statement because magnetic field lines are continuous loops, all closed surfaces have as many magnetic field lines going in as coming out. Hence, the net magnetic flux through a closed surface is zero.

question: Alivardi Khan was a Nawab of ______.
solution: (d) Alivardi Khan was the Nawab of Bengalfrom 1740 to 1756.He is also known for his victory during the Battle of Burdwan against the Maratha Empire during the Maratha invasions of Bengal.

question: Plants grown atwhich of the following places take up carbon dioxide during the night?
solution: (b) Plants grown in deserts take up carbon dioxide during the night. The plants that grow in deserts are referred to as Xerophytes. These are the plants that perform photosynthesis to absorb carbon dioxide during nighttime to prevent loss of water.

question: Bombay Stock Exchange became the first stock exchange in India to launch commodity derivatives contracts in gold and ______.
solution: (c) Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) became the first stock exchange in India to launch commodity derivatives contracts in gold and silver. BSE was established in 1875 by cotton merchant Premchand Roychand and is located in Dalal Street, Mumbai. It is the oldest Stock Exchange in Asia.

question: ______ is an alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies a bank-branch participating in theNEFT system.
solution: (a) IFSC is an alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies a bank branch participating in the NEFT system. Indian Financial System Code (IFSC) is a unique eleven-digit number that is a combination of alphabets and numerals. It is used to transfer funds online for NEFT, IMPS, and RTGS transactions.

question: Which of the following is NOT a storage root?
solution: (b) Breathing root is NOT a storage root. These roots grow upward or erect as they grow above the surface of the soil. They follow the negative geotropism to avail oxygen, hence these roots are called breathing roots. They are also called pneumatophores. These are common features in mangroves.

question: The main collections of Vedic hymns are called ______.
solution: (c) The main collections of Vedic hymns are called Samhita. The Rigveda Samhita is the oldest known Vedic Sanskrit text. It is a collection of 1,028 Vedic Sanskrit hymns and 10,600 verses in all, organized into ten books (Sanskrit: mandalas). The hymns are dedicated to Rigvedic deities.

question: In which of the following years was the Rajya Sabha first constituted?
solution: (a) The Rajya Sabha was first constituted in 1952. Dr. S Radhakrishnan was the first chairman of the Rajya Sabha, also the first Vice President of the nation.

question: Who among the following is the founder of the field of psychoanalysis?
solution: (d) Sigmund Freud is the founder of the field of psychoanalysis. Psychoanalysis is a method of treating mental disorders, shaped by psychoanalytic theory, which emphasizes unconscious mental processes and is sometimes described as depth psychology.

question: The ‘Lezim’ dance form is peculiar to which of the following states?
solution: (c) The ‘Lezim’ dance form is peculiar to Maharashtra.Lezim is especially popular in rural Maharashtra, often played during the Ganesh festival. The other main folk dances of Maharashtra are Lavani, Dhangarigaja, Koli, Gondhal, and Tamasha.

question: The colour of an emerald is generally ______.
solution: (a) The color of an emerald is generally green. Emeralds are formed when chromium, vanadium, and iron are present in the mineral beryl.

question: ISRO’s Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle (PSLV) successfully launched a remote sensing satellite of which country on 28th February 2021?
solution: (b) ISRO’s (PSLV) successfully launched a remote sensing SatelliteAmazonia-1 of Brazil on 28th February 2021 from Satish Dhawan Space Centre(SHAR), Sriharikota. This satellite would further strengthen the existing structure by providing remote sensing data to users for monitoring deforestation in the Amazon region and analysis of diversified agriculture across the Brazilian territory.

question: Which of the following states renamed the dragon fruit as ‘Kamalam’ in January 2021?
solution: (b) Gujarat renamed the dragon fruit as Kamalam in January 2021. Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupanihas changed the name of this fruit as the spikes or petals of the fruit resemble a lotus in bloom. Dragon fruit is the fruit of a species of wild cactus indigenous to south and central America.

question: Sandalwood grows in which type of forests?
solution: (d) Sandalwood grows in tropical deciduous forests. Teak is the most dominant species of this forest. Bamboos, sal, shisham, sandalwood, khair, kusum, arjun, mulberry are other commercially important species. Tropical deciduous forests are the most widespread forests of India.

question: Who among the following was the first Indian table tennis player ever to become a nine times senior national champion as of January 2021?
solution: (c) Achanta Sharath Kamal was the first Indian table tennis player ever to become nine. times senior national champion as of January 2021. He broke the record of eight times national champion Kamlesh Mehta and was awarded the Padma Shri in 2019.

question: ______ are thick deposits of glacial clay and other materials embedded with moraines.
solution: (a) Karewas are thick deposits of glacial clay and other materials embedded with moraines. Karewas are lacustrine deposits (deposits in a lake) in the valley of Kashmir and in the Bhaderwah valley of the Jammu division of Jammu and Kashmir. Theseare the flat-topped mounds that border the Kashmir valley on all sides.

question: Siddhendra Yogi, a doyen of the ______ dance form, was lauded as Adi Guru.
solution: (b) Siddhendra Yogi is a doyen of the Kuchipudi dance form. He is the author of 'Bhama Kalapam', the jewel of Kuchipudi and he is the one who brought a distinctive style to Kuchipudi. Kuchipudi is one of the eight major Indian classical dances and originated in the state of Andhra Pradesh.

question: As of January 2021, who among the following is the Union Minister for Information and Broadcasting?
solution: (b) As of January 2021, Prakash Javadekar is the Union Minister for Information and Broadcasting succeeding Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore. Prakash Javedkar is an Indian politician from Maharashtra and a member of the Bharatiya Janata Party.

question: Chandragupta led a revolt against the ______ and overthrew them.
solution: (d) Chandragupta Maurya led a revolt against the Nandas and overthrew them. He was the founder of the Mauryan empire and built one of the largest empires on the Indian subcontinent.

question: ______ is the external agency applied on a body to change its state of rest or uniform motion.
solution: (d) Force is the external agency applied on a body to change its state of rest or uniform motion. The SI unit of force is Newton.

question:
Study the following table and answer the question:
Number of students Appeared (A) and Passed(P) in an annual examination from four schools Q, R, S and T in five years (2014 to 2018.

The ratio of the total number of students appeared from school Q in 2017 and from school S in 2018 to the total number of students passed from school R in 2018 and school T in 2014, is:


data:image/png;base64,
solution:
(d)
Number of students appeared from school Q in 2017 = 350
Number of students appeared from school S in 2018 = 400
Number of students passed from school R in 2018 = 405
Number of students passed from school T in 2014 = 225
Ratio = (350 + 400) : (405 + 225) = 750 : 630 = 25 : 21

question: The value of (sin 37°.cos 53° + cos 37°.Sin 53°) - 4cos²37° - 7 + 4cos²53°tan²47°+ 4 - cosec²43° is:
solution:
(d)
(sin 37°.cos 53° + cos 37°.Sin 53°) - 4cos²37° - 7 + 4cos²53°tan²47°+ 4 - cosec²43°
= (sin²37° + cos²37°) - 4sin²53° - 7 + 4cos²53°tan²47° + 4 - sec²47°
= 1 - -33 = 1 + 1 = 2

question: AB is a chord of a circle in the minor segment with center O, C is a point on the minor arc of the circle between the points A and B. The tangents to the circle at A and B meet at the point P. If ∠ACB = 102°, then what is the measure of ∠APB?
solution:
(c)

∠ACB = 102°
∠AMB = 180° - 102° = 78°
∠AOB = 2 × 78° = 156°
∠APB = 180° - 156° = 24°

question: A shopkeeper marked every item 25% above the cost price and allowed 10% discount. Shruti, being a regular customer, got 5% additional discount on the bill and paid Rs.2394 for the item purchased. What is the cost price of the item (in Rs.)?
solution:
(b)
Let the cost price = 80
Marked price = 80 + (25% of 80) = 100
Selling price after 10% discount = 90
Selling price after 5% another discount = 85.5
85.5 unit = 2394
80 unit = 2240
Alternate Method
Let the cost price = 100x
Then 54×910×1920×100x = 2394
x = 2240

question: The average of x occurring 5 times and y occurring 7 times is 37. Also, the average of x occurring 7 times and y occurring 5 times is 35. The value of y is:
solution:
(c)
5x + 7y = 12 × 37…...×7…(i)
7x + 5y = 12 × 35…...×5…(ii)
(ii) - (i)
24y = 1008
y = 42

question: In an examination, 45% of all the students who appeared are boys and the rest are girls. If 60% of the boys and 70% of the girls passed, then what is the percentage of students who failed?
solution:
(d)Let total number of students = 200
Number of boys = 90
Number of girls = 110
Number of failed boys = 90 - (60% of 90) = 36
Number of failed girls = 110 - (70% of 110) = 33
Percentage =36 + 33200 × 100 = 34.5

question: The value of 18 ÷ [26 - {25 - (15 - 5) ÷ 2}] of 12 + 2 - 2 ÷ 4 × 16 is:
solution:
(d)
18 ÷ [26 - {25 - (15 - 5) ÷ 2}] of 12 + 2 - 2 ÷ 4 × 16
⇒ 18 ÷ [26 - {25 - 10 ÷ 2}] of 12 + 2 - 0.5 × 16
⇒ 18 ÷ [26 - {20}] of 12 + 2 - 8
⇒ 18 ÷ 72 + 2 - 8 = -234

question: What is the difference (in Rs.) between the simple interest and the compound interest on a sum of Rs. 8000 for 225years at the rate of 10% p.a., when the interest is compounded yearly?
solution:
(d)
Simple Interest = 10% for 2.4 years
= 24% of Principal
Compound interest till 2 years 10% + 10% + 10×10100= 21%
Total compound interest = 21% + 4% + 21×4100= 25.84%
According to the question
(25.84% - 24%) of 8000 = 1.84% of 8000 = 147.2

question: If x4 + y4 + x2 y2 = 21 and x² + y² - xy = 7, then what is the value of xy+yx?
solution:
(c)
x4 + y4 + x2 y2 = 21
x4 + y4 + 2x2y2 - x2y2 = 21
(x² + y² - xy)(x² + y² + xy) = 21
7(x² + y² + xy) = 21
(x² + y² + xy) = 3………(i)
(x² + y² - xy) = 7………(ii)
On solving,
x² + y² = 5
xy = - 2
xy+yx= x2+y2xy=-52

question:
The data given in the table shows the number of boys and girls enrolled in three different streams in a school over 5 years. (2012 to 2020)

What is the difference between the average of the number of boys in the commerce stream for the 5 years and the average of the number of girls in the Arts stream for the 5 years?


data:image/png;base64,
solution:
(d)
Average of boys in commerce stream = 35+32+36+28+395 = 34
Average of girls in arts stream = 36+43+42+46+435 = 42
Difference = 42 - 34 = 8

question:
Study the following table and answer the question:
Number of students Appeared (A) and Passed (P) in an annual examination from four schools Q, R, S and T, in five years (2014 to 2018)

2014 and 2018 is what percent less than the total number of students appeared from schools R and S in 2017?


data:image/png;base64,
solution:
(b)The total number of students passed from School Q in 2014 and 2018 = 240 + 320 = 560
Total number of students appeared from schools R and S in 2017 = 420 + 380 = 800
Percentage = 800-560800×100 = 30%

question: If 3sin²θ - cosθ - 1 = 0, 0° < θ < 90°, then what is the value of cotθ + cosecθ ?
solution:
(d) 3sin²θ - cosθ - 1 = 0
3 - 3cos2θ - cosθ - 1 = 0
3cos2θ + cosθ - 2 = 0
3cos2θ + 3cosθ - 2cosθ - 2 = 0
3cosθ(cosθ + 1) - 2(cosθ + 1) = 0
cosθ = ⅔ or -1 (negative value of cosθ is not possible between 0 to 90°)
Height = 5
cotθ + cosecθ = 25+35=55=5

question:
The following Bar Graphs represent the Export of Tea (in lakh tonnes) by two companies A and B during the years 2010 to 2015.
(Note: The data shown below is only for mathematical exercise. They do not represent the actual figures).

What is the ratio of the total exports of company B in 2011 and 2014 to the total exports of company A in 2012 and 2015?
solution:
(a)
Total exports of company B in 2011 and 2014 = 75 + 200 = 275
Total exports of company A in 2012 and 2015 = 120 + 220 = 340
Ratio = 275 : 340 = 55 : 68

question: If x + y = 3, and 1x + 1y = - 310, then the value of (x² + y²) is:
solution:
(c)x + y = 3
1x + 1y = - 310,
x + yxy = - 310,
3xy = - 310,
xy = - 10
(x² + y²) = (x + y)² - 2xy
(x² + y²) = 9 +20 = 29

question:
Simplify the following expression.
(375+125)2-(125-375)2375×375-125×125
solution:
(c)
(a + b)2 - (a - b)2 = 4ab
(375 + 125)² - (125 - 375)²375 × 375 - 125 × 125
4 × 375 × 125500 × 250 = 32

question: A and B together can complete a certain work in 20 days whereas B and C together can complete it in 24 days. If A is twice as good a workman as C, then in what time will B alone can do 40% of the same work?
solution:
(a)
Let the total work = 120 unit
Efficiency of A + B = 6 unit/d
Efficiency of B + C = 5 unit/d
A = 2C
B + 2C = 6
B + C = 5
On solving,
C = 1 and B = 4
Time taken by B = 484= 12 days

question: Point P lies outside a circle with centre O. Tangents PA and PB are drawn to meet the circle at A and B respectively. If ∠APB = 80°, then ∠OAB is equal to:
solution:
(b)

∠AOB = 180° - 80° = 100°
∠OAB +∠OBA = 180° - 100° = 80° (∠OAB = ∠OBA)
∠OAB = 40°

question: Akhil takes 30 minutes extra to cover a distance of 150 km if he drives 10 km/h slower than his usual speed. How much time will he take to drive 90 km if he drives 15 km per hour slower than his usual speed?
solution:
(b) Let the speed be x then
150x - 10 - 150x = 12
X2 - 10x = 3000
x2 - 10x - 3000 = 0
(x - 60) (x + 50) = 0
X = 60 because speed can’t be negative
So, 9060 - 15= 2hr

question: Chord AB of a circle of radius 10 cm is at a distance of 8 cm from the center O. If tangents drawn at A and B interact at P, then the length of the tangent AP (in cm) is:
solution:
(d)

In ΔOBC = BC2 = 102 - 82 = 62
ΔCOB and ΔBOPare similar as one angle is common and another one angle is of 90°.
So,
OCOB = CBPB
PB = 6 × 108 = 7.


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1667384423/word/media/image34.png

question: The perimeter of a semi-circle is 25.7 cm. What is its diameter (in cm)?
solution:
(c)Perimeter of a semi - circle = πr + 2r = 25.7
25.7 = r(3.14 + 2)
R = 5, Diameter = 10 cm

question: Find the value of sin⁴30° + cos⁴30° - sin 25°.cos 65° - sin 65°.cos 25°
solution:
(b)sin⁴30° + cos⁴30° - sin 25°cos 65° - sin 65°cos 25°
= (12)4 + (32)4 -(sin225° + cos225°)
116 + 916 - 1 = -38

question: Find the ratio between the fourth proportional of 12, 16, 6 and the third proportional of 4, 6.
solution:
(d)
Fourth proportional = ab = cd
1216 = 6x
x = 8
Third proportional = 6 × 64= 9
Ratio = 8 : 9

question: If the 8-digit number 888x53y4 is divisible by 72, then what is the value of (7x + 2y), for the maximum value of y?
solution:
(c)
For divisibility of 72, number should be divisible by 8 and 9
For divisibility of 8, check last 3 digits
Possible value of y = 0, 4, 8
For divisibility of 9, check digit sum
8 + 8 + 8 + x + 5 + 3 + 8 + 4 = 9 or its multiple
x = 1
(7x + 2y) = 7(1) + 2(8) = 23

question: ΔABC ∼ ΔDEF If the areas of ΔABCand ΔDEFare 100 cm2 and 81 cm2, respectively and the altitude of ΔDEF is 6.3 cm, then the corresponding altitude of ΔABCis:
solution:
(c)
Area of∆ABCArea of∆DEF = height of∆ABCheight of∆DEF2
10081 = x6.3
109 = x6.3
x = 7 cm

question: A trader sells an article at 16% below its cost price. Had he sold it for Rs.192.20 more, he would have gained 15%. The cost price (in Rs.) of the article is:
solution:
(b)
Let the cost price = 100
Selling price = 84
Selling price after 15% profit = 115
Difference = 115 - 84 = 31
31 unit = 192.2
100 unit = 620

question: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
solution:
(b) Hygeinic.
‘Hygienic’ is the correct spelling.

question:
Select the option that will substitute the underlined part of the given sentence. In case no substitution is needed, select ‘No substitution required’.
When I met the couple yesterday I noticed that the wife was more taller than her husband.
solution:
(d) taller
When we do a comparison between two things, we don’t use ‘more’ with a comparative degree (taller) because it becomes a case of superfluousness(not necessary). Hence, ‘taller’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.
Something that is to your advantage but happened by chance
solution:
(d)Fortuitous- something that is to your advantage but happened by chance
Occidental- related to the countries of the western part of the world.
Purposeful- having a definite aim or plan
Deliberate- done on purpose, planned

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in indirect speech.
Sneha said to me, “I was watching TV.”
option_1: Sneha told me that she was watching TV.
option_2: Sneha said to me that I was watching TV.
option_3: Sneha told me that she had been watching TV.
option_4: Sneha told me that I was watching TV.
solution:
(c) Sneha told me that shehad been watching TV. (Correct)
(a) Sneha told me that she was watchingTV. (Incorrect Tense)
(b) Sneha said to me that I was watching TV. (Incorrect Tense)
(d) Sneha told me that I was watching TV. (Incorrect Tense)

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.
A kick in the teeth
solution:
(b) A kick in the teeth- a grave setback
Example- Losing my job after my car broke down was a real kick in the teeth.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
Imran has found two good jobs in the advertisements of the newspaper.
option_1: Two good jobs are being found by Imran in the advertisements of the newspaper.
option_2: Two good jobs had found by Imran in the advertisements of the newspaper.
option_3: Two good jobs have been found by Imran in the advertisements of the newspaper.
option_4: Two good jobs has found by Imran in the advertisements of the newspaper.
solution:
(c) Two good jobshave been found by Imran in the advertisements of the newspaper. (Correct)
(a) Two good jobs are being found by Imran in the advertisements of the newspaper. (Incorrect Tense)
(b) Two good jobs had found by Imran in the advertisements of the newspaper. (Incorrect Tense)
(d) Two good jobs has found by Imran in the advertisements of the newspaper. (Incorrect Tense)

question:
The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them contains an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options.
We don't really / want a large house; / we are looking for some comfort / and some convenience on a moderate price.
option_1: and some convenience on a moderate price
solution:
(a) and some convenience on a moderate price.
There is a prepositional error in the given sentence. The preposition ‘on’ will be replaced with ‘at’ because we generally buy something ata low/high price, not on a low/high price. Hence, ‘some convenience at a moderate price’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.
Testify
solution:
(a)Affirm- to say formally or clearly that something is true
Testify- to make a formal statement that something is true
Oppose- to disagree with somebody’s beliefs, actions or plans and to try to change or stop them
Disprove- to show that something is not true
Invalidate- to show that an idea, a story, an argument, etc. is wrong

question:
Sentences of a paragraph are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the sentences in the right order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.
A. But a dove that happened to be sitting on a neighbouring tree saw the ant’s danger and, plucking off a leaf, let it drop into the water before him.
B. Just at that time, a fowler was spreading his net and was in the act of ensnaring the dove, when the ant, perceiving his object, bit his heel.
C. An ant went to a fountain to quench his thirst and, tumbling in, almost drowned.
D. The ant mounting upon it, was presently wafted safely ashore.
solution:
(c) CADB
Sentence C will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. an ant went to a fountain. However, Sentence A states that a dove saw the ant’s danger and, plucked off a leaf & let it drop into the water before him. So, A will follow C. Further, Sentence D states that the ant mounted upon it was presently wafted safely ashore & Sentence B states that a fowler was spreading his net just at that time, and was in the act of ensnaring the dove, when the ant, perceived his object & bit his heel. So, B will follow D. Going through the options, option (c) has the correct sequence.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.
Abolish
solution:
(a)Eliminate- to remove somebody/something that is not wanted
Abolish- to end law or system officially
Establish- to start or create an organization, a system, etc.
Continue- to keep doing something without stopping
Introduce- to bring in something new, use something, or take something to a place for the first time

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
Some people were tired of the long ______ in front of the mall and left without entering.
solution:
(a) wait.
‘Wait’ means to stay in a particular place. The given sentence states that some people were tired of staying in front of the mall and left without entering. Hence, ‘wait’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
The following sentence has beendivided into parts. One of them contains an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options.
Lalitha will go / to sister’s house / in Mumbai / this summer.
solution:
(a) to sister’s house.
There is a pronoun error in the given sentence. The possessive pronoun ‘her’ that is generally used for a female subject(Lalitha in the given sentence) is missing. Hence, ‘to her sister’s house’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.
A stumbling block
solution:
(b) A stumbling block- an obstacle to progress
Example- Unemployment is a stumbling block in the development of a country.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
Keats and Shelley were poets of the same period; they were ______.
solution:
(c) contemporaries.
‘Contemporaries’ are those people who live or do something at the same time as someone else like Keats and Shelley who were poets of the same period. Hence, ‘contemporaries’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.
To throw an event into confusion or disorder
solution:
(a)Disrupt- to throw an event into confusion or disorder
Detonate- to explode or to make a bomb, etc. explode
Erupt- to explode and throw out the fire, rock that has melted (lava), smoke, etc.
Explode- to burst with a loud noise

question:
Select the option that will improve the underlined part of the sentence. In case no improvement is needed, select 'No improvement'.
The teacher advised the children to not went near the lake.
solution:
(b) not to go.
The preposition ‘to’ always takes the first/base form of the verb(V1) with it. However, ‘go’ is the first form of the verb ‘went’. Hence, ‘not to go’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.
Revel
solution:
(c)Mourn- to feel and show great sadness, especially because somebody has died
Revel- enjoy oneself in a lively and noisy way
Appreciate- to understand the value of somebody/something
Rejoice- to feel or show great happiness
Enjoy- to get pleasure from something

question:
Sentences of a paragraph are given below in jumbled order. Arrange the sentences in the right order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.
A. However, its importance is primarily for its location.
B. But unlike other rivers, it is not used for shipping.
C. Although not the longest river, the Rio Grande is the most important river in America.
D. America has several long river systems.
solution:
(b) DCBA
Sentence D will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e.the river systems of America. However, Sentence C states that the Rio Grande is the most important river in America. So, C will follow D. Further, Sentence B states that, unlike other rivers, Rio Grande is not used for shipping & Sentence A states that its importance is primarily for its location. So, A will follow B. Going through the options, option (b) has the correct sequence

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.
Downcast
solution:
(d)Cheerful- showing that you are happy
Downcast- sad and without hope
Disappointed- sad because you/somebody/something did not succeed
Distressed- very upset or unhappy
Successful- having achieved what you wanted

question: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
solution:
(b) Scorpeon.
‘Scorpion’ is the correct spelling.

question:
Cloze Test:
The Panchatantra is a legendary collection of short stories from India. (96)______ composed in the 2nd century BC, Panchatantra is (97)______ to be written by Vishnu Sharma (98)______ with many other scholars. The purpose behind the composition (99)______ to implant moral values and governing (100)______ in the young sons of the king.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 96.
solution:
(d) Originally.
Originally means in the beginning, before any changes or developments. The given passage states that Panchatantra was originally composed in the 2nd century BC. Hence, ‘originally’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:
The Panchatantra is a legendary collection of short stories from India. (96)______ composed in the 2nd century BC, Panchatantra is (97)______ to be written by Vishnu Sharma (98)______ with many other scholars. The purpose behind the composition (99)______ to implant moral values and governing (100)______ in the young sons of the king.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 97.
solution:
(a) believed.
Believe means to think that something is true or possible. The given passage states that Panchatantra is believed to be written by Vishnu Sharma. Hence, ‘believed’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:
The Panchatantra is a legendary collection of short stories from India. (96)______ composed in the 2nd century BC, Panchatantra is (97)______ to be written by Vishnu Sharma (98)______ with many other scholars. The purpose behind the composition (99)______ to implant moral values and governing (100)______ in the young sons of the king.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 98.
solution:
(d) along
‘Along’ means with somebody. The given passage states that Panchatantra is believed to be written by Vishnu Sharma along with many other scholars. Hence, ‘along’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:
The Panchatantra is a legendary collection of short stories from India. (96)______ composed in the 2nd century BC, Panchatantra is (97)______ to be written by Vishnu Sharma (98)______ with many other scholars. The purpose behind the composition (99)______ to implant moral values and governing (100)______ in the young sons of the king.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 99.
solution:
(b) was
The passage is about Panchatantra which was written in the past so the given sentence will have a verb in the past tense(was). Hence, ‘was’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:
The Panchatantra is a legendary collection of short stories from India. (96)______ composed in the 2nd century BC, Panchatantra is (97)______ to be written by Vishnu Sharma (98)______ with many other scholars. The purpose behind the composition (99)______ to implant moral values and governing (100)______ in the young sons of the king.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 100.
solution:
(c) skills
Skill means the ability to do something well. The given passage states that the purpose behind the composition was to implant moral values and governing skills in the young sons of the king. Hence, ‘skills’ is the most appropriate answer.
